name: Pokok Ati ati
shortDesc: Ornamental plant with vibrant, colorful foliage.
description: Pokok Ati ati, also known as Coleus, is prized for its striking and diverse leaf colors and patterns. This easy-to-grow plant adds a splash of color to any garden or indoor space. Its foliage comes in a wide range of colors, including red, pink, yellow, green, and purple.
history: Native to Southeast Asia and Australia, Coleus has been cultivated for its ornamental foliage and is popular worldwide for its vibrant colors and ease of care.

careTips.sunlight: Partial shade to full shade (avoid harsh afternoon sun)
careTips.water: Keep soil consistently moist, but not waterlogged
careTips.fertilizer: Balanced liquid fertilizer every 4-6 weeks during growing season
careTips.pruning: Pinch back tips to encourage bushier growth

name: Bunga Kertas
shortDesc: Malaysia's national flower, perfect for any garden.
description: The national flower of Malaysia, our hibiscus trees produce stunning red flowers that bloom year-round. These versatile plants can be grown as shrubs or small trees.
history: Chosen as Malaysia's national flower in 1960, the Bunga Raya symbolizes courage and life to Malaysians.

careTips.pruning: Regular pruning for shape and flowers

name: Hibiscus Tree (Bunga Raya)
shortDesc: Malaysia's national flower, perfect for any garden.
description: The national flower of Malaysia, our hibiscus trees produce stunning red flowers that bloom year-round. These versatile plants can be grown as shrubs or small trees.
history: Chosen as Malaysia's national flower in 1960, the Bunga Raya symbolizes courage and life to Malaysians.

careTips.pruning: Regular pruning for shape and flowers

name: Cempaka Tree
shortDesc: Fragrant yellow flowers with cultural significance.
description: The Cempaka tree is known for its intensely fragrant yellow-orange flowers. Popular in traditional Malay culture, these flowers are often used in traditional ceremonies and perfumes.
history: Deeply rooted in Malay culture, Cempaka flowers are traditionally used in weddings and ceremonies.

name: Cuphea
description: Cuphea is a vibrant, low-maintenance plant known for its tubular flowers that attract hummingbirds and butterflies. Ideal for borders, containers, or ground cover, it thrives in warm climates and blooms profusely from spring to fall.
history: Native to Mexico and Central America, Cuphea has become a popular ornamental plant globally due to its striking flowers and ecological benefits for pollinators.

careTips.sunlight: Full sun to partial shade (4-6 hours daily)
careTips.water: Moderate watering, drought tolerant when mature
careTips.soil: Well-draining, slightly acidic to neutral pH
careTips.pruning: Deadhead spent flowers to promote new blooms
